title: Forming a Secular Gay Brotherhood
text:
Hi,

I am at the very beginning of forming a Secular Gay Brotherhood. This would be a co-operative, or commune if you like, of gay men interested in living together in community, bonding through a shared philosophy of naturism, education and philanthropy. I always envisioned some form of a phallic worship ritual and/or shrine, but that isn't required.

The group would be very similar to an all male religious group, like a monastery or priory, but would be secular in nature. 

There is an opportunity to obtain a vacant campus of buildings formerly used as a detention and education center for delinquent boys. 

I am seeking committed men serious about forming an active group to devise a business plan, explore funding opportunities, including crowd funding, and move forward to establish the Brotherhood formerly and make a competitive bid on the listed property.

In-kind help and donated services in the areas of: legal, business, accounting and tax, fundraising/development, advertising/promotion and tech/online/social media services are needed.

Please contact me with your thoughts on the project and I'll forward the property details and plans for you to review. 

Thank you!

In Brotherhood,

Max

P.S. Where else should this information be posted?

title: Therapy Group in SF for gay men over 50
text:
Get honest and caring support. 
Explore possibilities. 
Develop direction in your life. 

I am a licensed clinical psychologist and have been leading therapy groups since the 1970s. There are one or two openings in the therapy/support group I lead on Thursday evenings in San Francisco, for gay men over 50. 

Issues discussed in the group include clarifying one's life goals; relationships with friends, family, and partners; finding meaning and connection; and the many other challenges of aging. The age range of the current group members is broad, from the late 50s through the 70s. The group meets every Thursday evening from 7:00 to 8:30 pm, in my office on Clement Street. There is a monthly fee.

I offer a no-cost in-person screening interview. 

Thank you!

title: Drive, And Cross The USA For Free!
text:
I didn't know where to post this because we are looking for something different, as you will see. 

We are two bicycle riders from the East Bay who plan on riding across the USA, from Santa Monica to St. Petersburg, Florida, starting in June 2016 and ending mid to late August. 

We are looking for a driver for a support vehicle and the driver can bring a friend for company/as a chaperone. We will pay all expenses for both of you, including air fare, lodging and food during the trip. 

We will drive to Los Angeles where we can stay for a couple of days to sight see if you would like (I have a large condo there). We then start our ride toward Palm Springs and on to the Grand Canyon (a wonder of the world and photos really do not do it justice). From there we will travel through such places as Flagstaff and Sedona, Arizona, Albuquerque, New Mexico (with its Native American culture), Santa Fe (one of the art capitals of the world), Carlsbad Caverns, Austin (probably the most progressive city in Texas), San Antonio (home of the Alamo and its river walk which doesn't rival Venice but is nonetheless fun), Baton Rouge, New Orleans (home of Cajun cooking and Mardi Gras) and finally St. Augustine (the oldest continuously occupied European settlement in the US). We will spend rest and visiting days in the more interesting places so it won't be just a "drive by" experience.

There will be boring stretches of vast expanses, but more importantly, you will have the chance to see more small town "Americana" than most Americans get to see while experiencing Tex-Mex food, parts of the "Old West," Louisiana, Florida and much more. We will take a different route driving back across the country to see different places, probably including Las Vegas. 

Because the two of us will be riding our bikes going to Florida, your driving will only be from 50 miles to at most 115 miles per day, with some days off for our rest and to visit places of interest. We would like you to do laundry once a week or so while we are riding as well as some food shopping and preparation (lunches, such as sandwiches) and help with planning our lodging and stops.

You need to be good natured, responsible, easy to get along with, be drug free and, of course, have a valid driver's license with no major violations. This is perfect for a college student, a recent graduate who doesn't yet have a job or possibly a teacher who wants to spend vacation time exploring.

In the photo with the view in the background, I am 2nd from the right and Nick is 4th from the right. In the photo in front of a building, Nick is 3rd from the right (in the yellow) and I am immediately to his right, with the "Garneau" top. On the bikes, Nick is in the middle, I am on the left.

We are 2 responsible professional men who live in the East Bay (Nick in Pleasant Hill, me in Orinda). I don't know that it is relevant, but Nick is single and I am in a ltr. 

Let us know if you are interested.

Thank you, and here is to the adventure of a life time,

Rick

title: Inescapable something
text:
You and I are both a little lonely. I know, its hard to swallow but truth is we have trouble connecting day to day. I'm not insulting or judging, just trying to have a different and honest interaction. I feel vulnerable admitting it, but I know if someone reaches out, they will be genuine, and something like that is nice. We both have that knowledge of one another. I'm not desperate and I'm not searching for 'the one'. I have a good life which lacks that inescapable something.

I love words and the positive impact they can have on our minds. I don't have ANY hidden agendas and I won't judge you and only ask the same in return...this is simply a way for me to escape for a little while. I'd prefer to converse with someone my own age, mostly due to the amount of pop culture references I will likely be sprinkling into our correspondence. We don't have to write every day. I'm not always available and I'm not expecting you to be either.

As an aside: We're trying to put forth the very best qualities (both personality-wise and physical appearance) of ourselves or perhaps trying to shine up those we think will appeal to others. Trying to conform to some un-achievable archetype that doesn't really exist. We all have flaws and quirks that make us unique - and I think we should embrace and own them. Yes?

While meeting in person is not always plausible, it doesn't preclude us from sharing a photo or two for curiosities sake - but we don't have to do that either. Sometimes the mystery is the best part.

Read this somewhere and found it so appropriate:

I don't know why I chose this road
as blind success turns to folly 
as doubt and fear become commonplace 
the stout hearted become circumspect
the truth of lies so freely told;
we friends are made of liars and cheats 
no safety in the hearts of friends
no truth from lips so stained with tears.

Yep, this is in Strictly Platonic. There are some very good reasons for this. 1, I am not looking for meeting up with anyone here. I am single but I'm just looking to email/chat about this. So Men 4 Women is out. 2, Casual Encounters is full of utter and complete garbage. I looked around there 3 times today and saw nothing but mountains of spam and hookers. Awful!

So. What's the deal with this post then? The deal is there is something about stockings that is just completely delicious to me. I'm not talking about pantyhose or tights. I'm talking about thigh high stockings (with or without garter straps).

But having spent some time here I realize that this post is a total shot in the dark. The only time I see posts about lingerie like this it's dudes looking for women or other guys who are into it.

Sooooooooo... My goal here is to find a woman that is into this sort of lingerie too. A woman that is willing to share her thoughts. Baring that a woman that is curious as to why us men are so into lingerie ;)

This is NOT about meeting someone, or even an "in" to get, um, in your pants. I am single but just want to babble online.

Wish me luck. I'm going to need it!

title: Female Road Trip Buddy - w4w
text:
I've been exploring CA for years. I've been to Death Valley eleven times and I especially, love deserts and wide open spaces.

I'm a very youthful retired late middle-aged woman (I have many friends in their 30s and 40s). Road trips for me include easy hiking and exploring local towns' thrift stores and shops. I'm quite flexible about duration of trips. My biggest problem in retirement has been finding women who have the time, money and desire to hit the road without much of an agenda. 

I have a wide range of interests and am generally conceded to be very funny. I don't get my knickers in a twist over much. I'm a writer and big reader so I take my laptop and write when there's downtime.

You must be able to pull your own weight and share expenses such as gas and lodging. 

Spontaneity and a sense of humor and curiosity are absolutely essential. 

The point of road trips is to take a break from daily life so please be able to disconnect from electronica except for basic checking in with relatives and such. I don't want to find myself staring at the top of your head as you text and photograph your food.

Let's talk and meet and see if we're on the same page. The days are getting longer and I'll soon be rarin' to go. I have a brand new Kia Rio and a GPS. It's easier if you're in or near San Francisco, but not essential.

I'm not averse to tent camping, and still have my equipment.

title: Stoner IT geek musician guy in Seattle seeking new friends for stimula
text:
Maybe you've thought about moving to the PNW, or maybe you're just bored and want a new friend to exchange emails with. Whatever the case may be, I'm available for email or chat. Please only respond if you're going to take the time to write a decent response; no one-liners please. I appreciate well-written letters and I tend to get along with creative/intellectual types. I have been missing that type of connection lately.

So, being that I live in Seattle, you may have me somewhat figured out. I smoke weed, I drink coffee, I work in technology, and I'm progressive. I have LGBT friends and family. So, we may not mesh well if you're religious or conservative, though I'm open for debating stuff if that's your thing.

I work in IT for a popular retail company. As I mentioned, I work a night shift which leaves me fairly isolated, however I only work 3-4 nights a week, so that's nice because it allows me time to work on music and do other productive things like play video games and watch movies. I like working nights, being awake at night. It's peaceful and sort of like a whole different world. I do stay up until around noon, so it's not like I don't get to see daylight ever, but this schedule does not seem conducive to making new friends.

I play and record guitar, bass, synths, drums, and vocals. I don't have a band right now, but I'm hoping to put one together soon, and I'm hoping that playing my music live will help with meeting people. My music is sort of indie rock with some electronica. My musical tastes range from jazz like Ella Fitzgerald and Miles Davis, to bands like Tool and Radiohead. I was raised on The Beatles, Paul Simon, Billy Joel, Abba, classic rock. One of my favorite 'contemporary' bands is Pinback.

I like getting out and about when I can. There are so many great, beautiful places around Seattle to explore, hike, go camping, etc. I also enjoy traveling when I get the chance. I have been to Canada and Scotland and I'd like to visit many more places, take your pick.

I'm getting back into shape and I feel pretty good about it. I have a home gym where I work out about every other day. I'm also eating healthier; lots of vegetables and fewer carbs/sugar. I'm growing my own garden this year, too, so I'm excited about that.

So, yeah, that's a little about me, now how about you? Feel free to ask me anything, too. I look forward to hearing from you (ʘ‿ʘ)

I'm not alone I bet... Life is way too short to keep losing time as we are getting older everyday...

I am hoping to find a nice and sincere woman... a wise woman...attractive too...I'm mostly attracted to light complexure women....

I workout regularly and take care of myself... So I'm hoping to find a gal that likes similar things that is in good shape and takes care of herself!

We can find ourselves in situations that seemingly have no end. My wife has become more of a roommate than anything else. Circumstances that I will not go into here prevent me from leaving. Been together for a long time and now we just pass each other in the night. There are stupid arguments, stupid fights, no ugly but dormant. It's impossible to talk. Who would understand? Who would even believe? After all, we're are perceived as always been happy....We are what everyone envision as the 'perfect' marriage.

I am looking for a confident,friends with benefits, or anything with passion. I want companionship, friendship, communication, mutual respect, trust and caring. I'm looking for someone, preferably married, who may be in a similar situation and looking for a little something more in their life. Let's be each others friend, companion, confidant and possibly lovers if it goes that far. Communication is key with me. I like to exchange cute emails and chats during the day. It's simply a lot of fun because I'm a also romantic at heart.

I'm not looking to be your new husband nor am I looking for you to be my new wife. When we can, we'll steal moments away with each other.

I'm an educated hard working professional, funny, discreet, humorous, caring, polite, respectful, laid back person that knows how to treat a lady as a lady. I'm a romantic and caring person. I like to engage in funny give and take conversations with a bit of humorous bantering. I'm a passionate person who is missing much of that now in my life. I would like to meet and be with a special friend on many levels; intellectually, compassionately, as good friends that share and confide in each other and also passionately. I'm a good listener and very sensitive to the moods and needs of those close to me. Affectionate and caring. I keep my self in decent shape. If everything works out fine it will blossom into a nice romance.

Please put the " city that you live in" in subject replies so I know you have read me...

text: If you are familiar with these auteurs, and know their full names and admire their work, we should definitely get together. I am completely tired of having to drag my buddies to esoteric foreign and indie flicks they have no interest in, and if you are in the same boat as I am, and don't want to end up going to the movies alone any more, drop me a line. You have nothing to lose and everything to gain: great films, intelligent conversation, good food, and who knows, maybe even friendship and more!

title: Married Man Looking for Special Discreet Friendship
text:
Thanks for reading my ad and I am glad I caught your attention. I went back and forth with how I ought to title this ad and finally landed on advertising for a "special discreet friendship." This is my first foray into the world of seeking such a friendship since being married. I am simply interested in making my life a little more exciting, giving it an extra kick, having some intrigue. While I am still very much attached to my wife, the passion has somehow slipped away and my relationship has dulled over time. It is very comfortable, but not exciting. Do you feel that way? It may be that you and I just email each other some spicy titillating (although respectful) emails; it may be that we decide to discreetly meet and chat over coffee/tea, or maybe explore things further if we are both mutually inclined. There are lots of possibilities. As far as I am concerned, we can't go wrong...

I am a Caucasian man, tall, attractive, stocky, gym-goer, early fifties, advanced degrees, professional, live and work in San Francisco, clean-cut, respectful, and very discreet. I would love to hear from women -- married or single between the ages of 25 and 60 -- who, for whatever reasons, want to engage in a friendship in which all limits are respected yet at the same time exploration is in the cards (whether that be through e-mails, meet ups, etc.). I am honestly very open about how all of this might unfold. In the end, I do not wish to negatively impact my marriage and I don't want you (or your spouse/partner) hurt in any way; this is a very important value I hold dear and to which I am committed. 

I hope you are further intrigued by reading my ad and I hope to hear from you. I will reply to all who respond to my ad. Please tell me a bit about yourself (age, description, and any information about yourself that you would like to share) and what compelled you to answer my ad. What is your situation at the moment? What would you hope for out of a special friendship like this? I'll promise to get in touch with you soon.

I very much look forward to hearing from you... To know for sure that your email is not coming from a (ro)bot, please put the name of your favorite city in the subject line of your email. Thanks again and I hope to hear from you.
